channel.title: Website Programming on
channel.description: Recent content in Website Programming on

item.title: Connect to Wi-Fi From Terminal on Ubuntu 22.04/20.04 with WPA Supplicant
item.description: This article describes how to connect your Linux Ubuntu server to wifi, primarily if you are using a wifi adaptor card. In my example I will be connecting my W-iFi card from Gen Basic to my Lebre “Le Potato” s905x-cc single board computer server. Le Potato “s905x-cc” GenBasic Wi-Fi Card We will be storing our Wi-Fi network and password in a wpa_supplicant configuration file. Please note that you will need an existing internet connection to install the wpa_supplicant software before connecting to Wi-Fi.

item.title: Different Types of Security Login Standards for Applications
item.description: This article is about the different types of security standards used for logging into applications Security Login Standards The three main standards I will focus this article on are: HTTP Basic Auth - Least secure OAuth - More secure SAML - Most secure Despite these security standards, a single method is 100% safe. All best practices must be followed to reduce your chances as much as possible in preventing any security breaches to your websites and applications
